meanings.definition: To free someone from a mistaken belief or idea.
meanings.sent1: She helped in disabusing her friend of the ghost stories that scared her.
meanings.sent2: The teacher spent time disabusing the students of the myth that spiders are insects.
meanings.sent3: After disabusing him of the notion that aliens were coming, they all had a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: The magician's tricks disabused the audience of their belief in supernatural powers.
meanings.sent5: The clear explanation disabusing the misunderstanding was like turning on a light in a dark room.

meanings.definition: To correct a false impression or misconception.
meanings.sent1: He was disabusing the public of the misconception that all snakes are venomous.
meanings.sent2: The article aimed at disabusing readers of the false idea that all sharks are man-eaters.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show disabused the audience of the mistaken belief that all clowns are scary.
meanings.sent4: Her detailed presentation disabused the team of the notion that the project was easy.
meanings.sent5: The documentary disabusing common myths was eye-opening and informative.
